original: KABLBOM, Karl Bertil Frithiof, Civilingenjör, Landskrona, f Helsingtuna 13/12 02 av Victor Algot K o Alma Olsson, gm Helfrid Norberg. CTH (skpsbyg). Rit v Kockums mek verkst Malmö 26—27, konstr v Lindholmens varv Gbg 27—29, d :o Hbgs varv 29, 2. varvsing Oskarsh varv 30—31, ritkont.ch öresundsvarvet Lkr 31—39, övering sed. 39.
translated: KABLBOM, Karl Bertil Frithiof, Civil Engineer, Landskrona, born in Helsingtuna on December 13, 1902, to Victor Algot K and Alma Olsson. Married Helfrid Norberg in the year 19xx. Graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (CTH) with a specialization in shipbuilding. Worked as a draftsman at Kockums mechanical workshop in Malmö from 1926 to 1927, and as a designer at Lindholmens shipyard in Gothenburg from 1927 to 1929. Then worked at the Helsingborg shipyard in 1929 and as a second shipbuilder at Oskarshamn shipyard from 1930 to 1931. Joined the drawing office of Öresundsvarvet in Landskrona from 1931 to 1939, and became the chief engineer in 1939.

structured.name: Karl Bertil Frithiof Kablbom
structured.description: Karl Bertil Frithiof Kablbom was a Swedish Civil Engineer born on December 13, 1902, in Helsingtuna, Sweden. He was married to Helfrid Norberg. He completed his education at the Royal Institute of Technology (CTH) with a specialization in shipbuilding. He worked at various shipyards and mechanical workshops, including Kockums mechanical workshop in Malmö from 1926 to 1927, Lindholmens shipyard in Gothenburg from 1927 to 1929, Helsingborg shipyard in 1929, Oskarshamn shipyard from 1930 to 1931, and Öresundsvarvet in Landskrona from 1931 to 1939. Karl Bertil Frithiof Kablbom became the chief engineer in 1939. The date of his death is unknown.
